meanings.definition: To take something away from someone
meanings.sent1: The bully deprives the kids of their lunch money.
meanings.sent2: The thief deprives the store of its valuable items.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel deprives the birds of their seeds.
meanings.sent4: The storm deprives the town of electricity.
meanings.sent5: The strict teacher deprives the students of recess.

meanings.definition: To prevent someone from having or enjoying something
meanings.sent1: The locked door deprives us of entering the room.
meanings.sent2: The rain deprives us of having a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent3: The broken swing deprives the children of fun at the playground.
meanings.sent4: The traffic jam deprives us of reaching our destination on time.
meanings.sent5: The noise outside deprives us of a peaceful sleep.
